{{mergefrom|List of health ministries|date=September 2012}} {{globalize|date=December 2010}} A '''health department''' or '''health ministry''' is a part of [[government]] which focuses on issues related to the general [[health]] of the [[citizenry]]. [[Subnational entity|Subnational entities]], such as [[State (administrative division)|states]], [[county|counties]] and [[city|cities]], often also operate a health department of their own. Health departments perform [[food licensing]] and [[food inspection]] (the person who performs this job is often called a [[Health Inspector]]), [[vaccination]] programs, free [[Sexually transmitted disease|STD]] and [[HIV]] tests, and other [[medical]] assistance. Health departments also compile [[statistics]] about [[health issues]] of their area. In 1986, several of the worlds' national health departments met to establish an international guideline by which health departments operate. The meeting was in [[Ottawa, Canada]], and hence the guidelines established are known as the [[Ottawa Charter]]. The Ottawa Charter was designed to ‘achieve Health for All’.
"Health department" can also refer to a [[university]] health [[academic department|department]].
==Health departments around the world== {{See also|State health agency}} :''See also: [[local health department| Local Health Department]]'' :''See also: [[Ministry of Health (disambiguation)|Ministries of Health around the world]]''
===National=== Most [[executive (government)|executive]] governments in the world are divided into departments or [[ministry (government department)|ministries]]. In most such cases, there is a department responsible for health. Some examples: * {{flagicon|Afghanistan}} Afghanistan - [[Afghan Ministry of Public Health]] * {{flagicon|Australia}} Australia - [[Department of Health and Ageing]] * {{flagicon|Canada}} Canada - [[Health Canada]] * {{flagicon|China}} People's Republic of China ** Mainland China - [[Ministry of Health of the People's Republic of China]] ** {{flagicon|Hong Kong}} Hong Kong - [[Food and Health Bureau]] and [[Department of Health (Hong Kong)|Department of Health]] ** {{flagicon|Macau}} Macau - [[Secretariat for Social Affairs and Culture (Macau)]] * {{flagicon|Ireland}} Ireland - [[Department of Health (Ireland)|Department of Health]] * {{flagicon|New Zealand}} New Zealand - [[Ministry of Health (New Zealand)|Ministry of Health]], previously the Department of Health * {{flagicon|Philippines}} Philippines - [[Department of Health (Philippines)|Department of Health]] * {{flagicon|Singapore}} Singapore - [[Ministry of Health (Singapore)|Ministry of Health]] * {{flagicon|South Africa}} South Africa [[South African Department of Health]] * {{flagicon|South Korea}} South Korea [[ the National Health Insurance Corporation]] * {{flagicon|South Sudan}} South Sudan [[Ministry of Health (South Sudan)|Ministry of Health]] * {{flagicon|UK}} United Kingdom: [[Department of Health (United Kingdom)|Department of Health]] ** Northern Ireland - [[Department of Health, Social Services and Public Safety]] ** {{flagicon|Scotland}} Scotland - [[Scottish Executive Health Department|Scottish Government Health Department]] ** {{flagicon|Wales}} Wales - [[Department of Health and Social Services (Wales)|Department of Health and Social Services]]<ref>[http://new.wales.gov.uk/about/departments/dhss/?lang=en Health and Social Services] new.wales.gov.uk, accessed 8 October 2008</ref> *{{flagicon|Taiwan}} Republic of China (Taiwan) - [[Department of Health (Republic of China)|Department of Health]] * {{flagicon|US}} United States - [[United States Department of Health and Human Services]] (HHS)
===Sub-national=== All [[U.S. state]]s have a '''[[state health department]]'''. [[County (United States)|Counties]], [[city|cities]], metropolitan areas, districts, and tribes may also have a department of health. '''[[local health department|Local health departments]]''' protect and promote health and well-being for all people in their communities by coordinating programs and services that make it easier for people to be healthy and safe from [[public health]] emergencies. The [[Los Angeles County Department of Health Services]] is an example of a local health department.
Sub-national entities in other countries, such as the [[states of Australia]], also have their own health departments.
